result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurtis T Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, Kurtis T
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant Kurtis T Krueger in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Kurtis T Krueger.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Detective Christopher Moss City of Waukesha PD 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Christopher Moss of the City of Waukesha Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  
Cross examination by attorney Nimmer.
Redirect by Attorney Will.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with witness listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

1:06 PM . Defendant Kurtis T Krueger in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula, as a friend of the court.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.
